name: megaenvironment
description: Provides integration with The Macroassembler AS, among other features.

megaenvironment.codeOptions.defaultCPU.description: The default CPU the assembler should use when it isn't specified in the code. The Mega Drive uses the Motorola 68000 as the main processor.

megaenvironment.codeOptions.superiorMode.description: Setting this means the assembler will issue warnings when a 68k privileged instruction takes place in your code, if not otherwise stated using "supmode".

megaenvironment.buildControl.outputRomNa.description: The output ROM file name. Leave it blank if you want this to have the same name as the main source code file.

megaenvironment.buildControl.includeRomD.description: Whether the output ROM file name should include date and time after the user's name.

megaenvironment.buildControl.enablePrevi.description: Whether the latest version should get marked as a previous ROM to avoid getting replaced. The latest build has the highest number.

megaenvironment.buildControl.previousRom.description: The maximum amount of .pre ROMs before it starts replacing the latest build. Leaving it to 0 is not recommended, as it generates an unlimited amount of previous builds.

megaenvironment.sourceCodeControl.mainFi.description: The main source code file name used in the project, where the code gets executed.

megaenvironment.sourceCodeControl.consta.description: The source code file name of the constants used in the project. Used when EASy68k opens up. Leave it blank if you aren't providing it.

megaenvironment.sourceCodeControl.variab.description: The source code file name of the variables used in the project. Used when EASy68k opens up. Leave it blank if you aren't providing it.

megaenvironment.sourceCodeControl.genera.description: Check this if you want a listing file to be generated each time a build is assembled. Useful for debugging.

megaenvironment.sourceCodeControl.listin.description: The file name of the code listing with extension ".lst". Leave it blank if you want this to have the same name as the main source code file.

megaenvironment.sourceCodeControl.genera.description: Check this if you want every warning and error to be redirected in a text file. This will also suppress warnings automatically.

megaenvironment.sourceCodeControl.errorF.description: The file name of the error listing with extension ".log". Leave it blank if you want this to have the same name as the main source code file.

enumDescriptions: Choose not to generate any debug files.
AS-specific MAP format. The information format is comprised of a symbol table and a table describing the assignment of source lines to machine addresses.
Atmel format used by the AVR tools.
megaenvironment.sourceCodeControl.genera.description: Check this to instruct AS to print a debug file containing the information for the program. The extension depends on the format you're choosing.
Check this if you want a listing file representing all sections to be issued. Nesting is Pascal-like indentations.
Check this if you want a listing file representing all macros that don't use "NOEXPORT" to be issued. File name is the same as the main source code, with extension ".mac".
Check this if you want a listing file representing the source text processed by the macro processor and conditional assembly. The file extension is ".i".

megaenvironment.sourceCodeControl.cleani.description: Choose which files get deleted when running any cleaning commands.

megaenvironment.sourceCodeControl.curren.description: The directories where the assembler will look for resources (when using "include" or "binclude", for instance).

megaenvironment.sourceCodeControl.caseSe.description: Check this to make any symbol case sensitive in your code.

megaenvironment.backupOptions.includeBac.description: Whether the output backup file name should include date and time after the user's name.

megaenvironment.backupOptions.backupFile.description: The name of the backup files. Default name is "Backup".

megaenvironment.miscellaneous.fillValue.description: The hexadecimal value used to fill empty spaces in the ROM. Set it to FF if you plan to use an EPROM burner, since they tend to skip writing to these areas.
megaenvironment.miscellaneous.fillValue.patternErrorMessage: Must be a valid 8-bit hex value (e.g. 00 to FF)

megaenvironment.miscellaneous.errorLevel.description: The detail level of warning, error and fatal messages. The higher the value, the more information about a possible error will be printed.

megaenvironment.miscellaneous.displayErr.description: Whether the terminal should display errors along with their number defined by the assembler.

megaenvironment.miscellaneous.AS-StyledE.description: Whether the terminal should display errors using the original AS syntax.

megaenvironment.miscellaneous.lowercaseH.description: Whether any hexadecimal value in the various outputs should be lowercase. Primarily for personal preference (and what a taste!).

megaenvironment.miscellaneous.suppressWa.description: Whether the terminal should suppress the assembler warnings.

megaenvironment.miscellaneous.quietOpera.description: Whether the terminal should print only the errors. By default, the terminal prints the output each time a build is assembled, but it only pops up when an error occurs.

megaenvironment.miscellaneous.verboseOpe.description: Whether the terminal should always show the output every time a build is assembled. By default, the terminal only pops up when an error occurs.

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
